frameDefinitions: An Entity began its existence in the context of a location of Origin, which is a discourse-salient place, or culture.
An Agent has an Attribute which can take different Values, and the Agent selects and then begins to use some Value for that Attribute.
An Agent removes a Theme from a Source so that the it is in the Agent's possession.
Unless a particular Required_situation obtains, Negative_consequences will follow.
A generally large group of people, the Combatants, are engaged in a chaotic, violent, and usually protracted Fight amongst themselves.
A Behavior is classified as entrenched for a Protagonist or a Society.
frameExamples: Obviously there are species that are <t>native</t> to China or used in Chinese Medicine that aren't used in Western or Cherokee Medicine and vice versa.
They scoff at their opponents and <t>assume</t> an air of superior knowledge
Milton <t>took</t> the can of beer out of the refrigerator.
You <t>must</t> turn in your test by 5 p.m.
listRoleDefinitions: The item whose <fen>Origin</fen> is under discussion.
The discourse-salient place or culture where the <fen>Entity</fen> was produced.
The <fen>Agent</fen> selects a <fen>Value</fen> for his/her <fen>Attribute</fen> and begins to use it.
The <fen>Attribute</fen> of the <fen>Agent</fen> can take on several <fen>Value</fen>s, selected by the <fen>Agent</fen> .
The <fen>Value</fen>, chosen and made effective by the <fen>Agent</fen>, specifies the <fen>Attribute</fen>.
The time period when the <fen>Agent</fen> selects and begins to put into effect the <fen>Value</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Agent</fen> has the <fen>Attribute</fen> which can take different <fen>Value</fen>.
The person who takes possession of the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The <fen>Agent</fen> takes possession of the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The location of the <fen>Theme</fen> prior to the taking.
When the taking takes place.
Where the taking takes place.
The state-of-affairs which prevents <fen>Negative_consequences</fen>.
The period during which the <fen>Required_situation</fen> is necessary to prevent negative consequences.
The location within which the <fen>Required_situation</fen> is required.
The <fen>Combatants</fen> participate as fighters in the <fen>Fight</fen>.
The violent activity.
When the <fen>Fight</fen> takes place.
Where the <fen>Fight</fen> takes place.
This Frame Element marks expressions that indicate the entrenched <fen>Behavior</fen>.
This Frame Element marks expressions that indicate whose entrenched <fen>Behavior</fen> is at issue.
This role marks expressions that indicate a region where the <fen>Behavior</fen> is  entrenched.

<fex>On January 1, 2001</fex>, our nation will adopt the US dollar as our official currency.
